feed.title: Feynman Technique Rocks
feed.subtitle: The blog where I teach the things I'm learning.

entry.title: I’ve decided to learn C# in 2021.

link.title: I’ve decided to learn C# in 2021.

entry.content:
I’ve decided to learn C# in 2021. I believe there are numerous reasons to learn C# and here are my reasons.


1. C# is versatile

C# can be used to create numerous different applications.


You could use it to create desktop applications, web apps (both in backend and frontend), cloud applications, games development and mobile applications.


I know Python programming. Python is also a versatile language. I thought it’d be nice to add C# to my tools as well. (2 Swiss knives !)


2. Game Development

I’ve watched a couple of documentaries about game development and I think game development requires huge amount of engineering skills.


Many people - especially adults who don’t know about games - think that games are waste of time but I think it’s a great area to apply engineering skills. I’ve been a gamer as long as I’ve known myself.


I think learning C# and developing a basic 3D games would be so much fun.


3. Huge Community Support and Number of Existing Libraries

C# has been around for more than 20 years. It’s built its community along the way and it’s been doing it since then.


There are great books and video lessons for any C# subjects.


As a beginner, I believe I would be able to learn all the answers for my beginner questions. There are many useful answers on Stack Overflow and many great blog posts for your possible questions. (I hope this blog would be one of them.)


Another good thing about C# is that the people working with it. They’ve created lots of great tools and libraries for others to use. You can get your project ready by getting many libraries together. It’s convinent and mind-blowing !
entry.summary: I’ve decided to learn C# in 2021. I believe there are numerous reasons to learn C# and here are my reasons.

entry.title: The Mental Model Behind Every High-Performer I Know

link.title: The Mental Model Behind Every High-Performer I Know

entry.content:
Never in all their history have men been able truly to conceive of the world as one: a single sphere, a globe, having the qualities of a globe, a round earth in which all the directions eventually meet, in which there is no center because every point, or none, is center — an equal earth which all men occupy as equals. The airman's earth, if free men make it, will be truly round: a globe in practice, not in theory.


Science cuts two ways, of course; its products can be used for both good and evil. But there's no turning back from science. The early warnings about technological dangers also come from science.


What was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that man set foot on the Moon but that they set eye on the earth.


Never in all their history have men been able truly to conceive of the world as one: a single sphere, a globe, having the qualities of a globe, a round earth in which all the directions eventually meet, in which there is no center because every point, or none, is center — an equal earth which all men occupy as equals. The airman's earth, if free men make it, will be truly round: a globe in practice, not in theory.


Science cuts two ways, of course; its products can be used for both good and evil. But there's no turning back from science. The early warnings about technological dangers also come from science.


What was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that man set foot on the Moon but that they set eye on the earth.


The Final Frontier

Never in all their history have men been able truly to conceive of the world as one: a single sphere, a globe, having the qualities of a globe, a round earth in which all the directions eventually meet, in which there is no center because every point, or none, is center — an equal earth which all men occupy as equals. The airman's earth, if free men make it, will be truly round: a globe in practice, not in theory.


Science cuts two ways, of course; its products can be used for both good and evil. But there's no turning back from science. The early warnings about technological dangers also come from science.


What was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that man set foot on the Moon but that they set eye on the earth.

What was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that man set foot on the Moon but that they set eye on the earth.

The airman's earth, if free men make it, will be truly round: a globe in practice, not in theory.


Science cuts two ways, of course; its products can be used for both good and evil. But there's no turning back from science. The early warnings about technological dangers also come from science.


What was most significant about the lunar voyage was not that man set foot on the Moon but that they set eye on the earth.
